summary: This is an email chain from July 25, 2019, discussing the status of obtaining investigative reports from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding an incident involving Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reveal that Epstein was found in his cell with a noose around his neck and was placed on suicide watch, and that his cellmate reported being threatened. The correspondents are coordinating to obtain official files and reports on the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; reported to have been found in his cell with a noose around his neck and placed on suicide watch at MCC New York.

persons.name: Tartaglione
persons.context: Mentioned as having a legal team that, along with Epstein's team, is to receive redacted reports from the MCC investigation.

events.title: Epstein Found with Noose in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York at 0127 hours in a fetal position with a noose around his neck. He was escorted to medical, assessed, and initially placed on suicide watch, later downgraded to suicide observation.

events.title: Cellmate Reports Threat
events.description: Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein had threatened to kill him.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC New York with a noose around his neck.
Epstein was initially placed on suicide watch following the incident but was subsequently downgraded to suicide observation.
Epstein's cellmate reported that Epstein had threatened to kill him.
The incident was under investigation by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) at the time of the emails.
The email chain shows coordination among legal/administrative personnel to obtain official reports from the MCC about the incident, indicating concerns about the accuracy of initial information.
